Articles.Content:
Longer video (with better quality too) just posted by SpaceX!! Just look at it fighting to remain vertical (and yes, those are indeed the cold nitrogen thrusters at the end)!!

EDIT: video not public yet (and apparently taken down shortly after I posted), so I am removing the link. Let's hope they make it public very soon.

For those who did not see it: it was absolutely awesome! They were so, so close!

Edited April 15, 2015 by Meithan
Vid up!
Let's refrain from posting unlisted videos and anything else that appears leaked, alright?
And both have stopped working.

Let's refrain from posting unlisted videos and anything else that appears leaked, alright?

Aaargh, I got carried away in my excitement and thought it'd be alright to post it since SpaceFlightNow shared it on Twitter. Sorry, deleting post!

Let's refrain from posting unlisted videos and anything else that appears leaked, alright?

I saw the video reported on spaceflightnow.com and it appeared official. How did you know it was leaked?

I saw the video reported on spaceflightnow.com and it appeared official. How did you know it was leaked?

Wasn't aware of that. It was an unlisted video and SpaceX switched it to private very, very fast.
Just saw the new video, they were so close!

I wanna see!

EDIT: Not private anymore! They were SOOOO close!
ARHHRAHGHGH! They were like 1 second from success! The next one is going to be amazing.
Mirrored all over the place already, wow. Alright, I'll give in and update the OP with it...

here's another video link, which is repertoried

but wow, the explosion might have caused more damage than last time to the drone landing platform. (as the rocket landed on a side, looks like an almost full body slam on the platform)

now, it's hard to say with the smoke if the rocket tilted or not towards the equipment boxes when it fell. like one spaceX engineer said, they falcon punched the drone ship

and that cold gas nitrogen RCS fighting to keep the rocket upright ! soo KSP

Edited April 15, 2015 by sgt_flyer

Wow they were even closer than I had thought after seeing the first, short video and the pictures!

Maybe next time they need to send Jeb up to land it!

After the last two times JRtI has been out and hit(by waves or rockets), I have little fear for it...

Great video this time, much better quality as well

Wow, beautiful video! Can't wait 'til next try!

I bet no one hopes for success more than the guys whose job it is to clean and fix and paint the barge.

"How many %@*# rocket disasters do we have to clean up after!?"

Incredible video. I didn't expect the crash to be so dramatic.

Can we expect video from the barge itself? ( and audio )
I think that will have to wait a bit, until the barge comes home

Incredible video. I didn't expect the crash to be so dramatic.

Can we expect video from the barge itself? ( and audio )

Elon Musk suggested on Twitter yesterday that they would release the barge video after the ASDS gets back to port, which should happen in the next 24 hours or so.

This was SO close. I wanted it to land, but I'm sort of glad since I told a bunch of friends that the day it lands, party at my house, and it was a school and work night. June 19th is a Friday, so even with a scrub and a 2d chance, I can have a better party if they nail it.

SpaceX got a song

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yypBjVpDJZY

Now it seems that this video is blocked in my country (Canada) due to copy right concerns by SME. Is that the same for you guys? I am confused because the video was a parody and it was made my Cinesaurus. I wonder who SME is?
I could watch it for some time but now its blocked here in germany, too.
Blocked here in the US as well, a quick google tells me that SME is Sony Music entertainment. So basically copyright infringement of Uptown Funk.

Blocked here in the US as well, a quick google tells me that SME is Sony Music entertainment. So basically copyright infringement of Uptown Funk.

Parody's are protected so it should be a false claim, it might have been a bot that flagged it.
